result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Matthew T Schroepfer

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
Notice Regarding United States Passport for Criminal Defendant
The original document name was titled: Notice Regarding US Passport
The original history event date is: 06-07-2022
Preliminary hearing on July 22, 2022 at 10:15 am.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant not to leave the State of Wisconsin without prior authorization from the Court.  Defendant to surrender their passport to the Waukesha Criminal Traffic Office (Room C226) within 24 hours of release from custody.  Defendant is not permitted to apply for the issuance,  duplicate nor renewal of a passport and/or passport card during the pendency of this action.   Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program under Level 2 supervision.  The defendant is ordered to comply with drug testing through WCS.  Drug testing frequency pursuant to Pretrial Supervision Program protocols. Defendant to pay costs associated with drug testing.  The Defendant to report to WCS within 1 business day of being released.

02:36 PM Defendant Matthew T Schroepfer in court, in custody, with attorney Amanda Marie Nimmer.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  
Court advises of right to an attorney.  
Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.
Preliminary Hearing requested.  Preliminary time limits waived.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 22, 2022 at 10:15 am.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
